This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=AOM-EDU.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2014-12-29T14:51:57Z Kara Ward 2014-12-29T09:51:53-05:00 2014-12-29T09:51:53-05:00 CALL FOR AUTHORS: The SAGE International Encyclopedia of Travel and Tourism https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AOM-EDU;5f3d1239.1412 CALL FOR AUTHORS: *The SAGE International Encyclopedia of Travel and<br>Tourism*<br><br>We are inviting academic editorial contributors to *The SAGE International<br>Encyclopedia of Travel and Tourism.* In a multidisciplinary approach, this<br>encyclopedia examines the world travel and tourism industry, which is<br>expected to grow at an annual rate of four percent for the next 10 years.<br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOver 675 entries are organized A-Z across 4 volumes in the following<br>categories: [...] Kara Ward 2014-11-26T12:10:01-05:00 2014-11-26T12:10:01-05:00 Business Cases - Marketing - Call for Authors - Paid https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AOM-EDU;2e585d41.1411 SAGE Business Cases is an informative new online offering from SAGE. The<br>collection, consisting of business and management case studies, associated<br>teaching notes and videos will be hosted on SAGE\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds premier eBook platform,<br>SAGE Knowledge, and will be made available to academic libraries on a<br>global basis, allowing for institution-wide online access to every case<br>study. Golson Media, producer of this project, offers an honorarium of<br>$150. [...] Social Sciences 2014-09-22T09:29:24+00:00 2014-09-22T09:29:24+00:00 HEA New to teaching workshop: Building career foundations - 2nd October - Leicester Conference Centre https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AOM-EDU;3bb502f7.1409 ****Apologies for cross-posting****<br><br>HEA New to teaching workshop: Building career foundations<br><br>2 October 2014, Leicester Conference Centre<br><br>Dr Ruth Pilkington<br><br>This day-long event combines a keynote presentation from former Head of Learning and Teaching Policy at HEFCE, William Locke, on the changing nature of academic careers in higher education, with two 2-hour new-to-teaching sessions.
